Experience Microprocessor Validation Engineer IBM February 2015  – Present (7 months) Austin, Texas Research Staff Member IBM September 2005  –  February 2015  (9 years 6 months) Haifa A team leader and a SW engineer in IBM Research Hardware Verification Technologies Department. 
Developer of HW verification tools. As part of my role, I am responsible for all aspects of the tools development, including tool architecture, design and implementation. I am also responsible for deployment of the tools for variety of architectures and designs. 
Developer of Threadmill, a bare-metal exercisers for post-silicon processor validation, Genesys Pro, a test program generator for processor functional verification and DeepTrans - library for address translation test generation. Summary An assertive, adaptive, and animated senior studying Electrical and Computer Engineering at Texas A&M University, with over 9 years of experience in the IT industry. I’m seeking a career opportunity where I can apply my engineering background, software/hardware, leadership, creativity, and IT skills in a dynamic team to create amazing products for the consumer world. Summary An assertive, adaptive, and animated senior studying Electrical and Computer Engineering at Texas A&M University, with over 9 years of experience in the IT industry. I’m seeking a career opportunity where I can apply my engineering background, software/hardware, leadership, creativity, and IT skills in a dynamic team to create amazing products for the consumer world. An assertive, adaptive, and animated senior studying Electrical and Computer Engineering at Texas A&M University, with over 9 years of experience in the IT industry. I’m seeking a career opportunity where I can apply my engineering background, software/hardware, leadership, creativity, and IT skills in a dynamic team to create amazing products for the consumer world. An assertive, adaptive, and animated senior studying Electrical and Computer Engineering at Texas A&M University, with over 9 years of experience in the IT industry. I’m seeking a career opportunity where I can apply my engineering background, software/hardware, leadership, creativity, and IT skills in a dynamic team to create amazing products for the consumer world. Experience System Hardware Engineer (Intern) IBM July 2015  – Present (2 months) Austin, TX ● Performed stress tests on IBM’s POWER8 Systems at all sectors of hardware, software, and firmware such as I/O adapters, CPU, Memory, HDD/SSD, and OS build (Linux or AIX) ensuring the systems were ready for gold release.  
 
● Validated the POWER8 Servers by executing tests via a variety of debugging tools such as Hardware Management Console (HMC), Linux performance tools, and bash scripts to determine root cause of failures to the system. 
 
● Utilized the system’s VIOS (Virtual OS) partitions, kept logs of every step of the testing procedure, opened defects in order to resolve the errors with key developers before the systems were released to the consumer market. 
 
● System Hardware Test Engineer Internship in IBM's Systems & Technology Group (STG) located in Austin, TX. (Summer 2015) Application Engineer (Intern/Co-op) Toshiba International Corporation October 2013  –  April 2015  (1 year 7 months) College Station, TX - Houston, TX ● Provided technical support for industrial devices; such as motors, VFD (variable frequency drives), and HVAC (heating, ventilating, and air conditioning) units. 
 
● Maximized the efficiency of a client’s application by remotely programming their VFD to their motor, saving an average of 45 minutes per service call. Arranged customers based on cases/leads using Microsoft Dynamics CRM; keeping a clean concise record of each interaction. 
 
● Supported clients in programming PLCs (Programmable Logic Controllers), Industrial protocols including Modbus, Ethernet IP, PROFIBUS, PROFINET, and DeviceNet to their VFDs.  
 
● Assisted the sales department with product support including technical presentations, proper application of Toshiba products, reviewed customer engineering specifications, preparation of quotations, and obtained answers to questions at all the stages of technical support, production, and inventory. 
 
● Developed and reviewed product literature such as manuals, brochures, and application notes for customer distribution. Created Spanish literature such as PowerPoint presentations for Toshiba’s South American market. 
 
● Co-op taken at a satellite office in Bryan, TX during Spring/Fall school semesters while attending Texas A&M full-time. (Fall 13, Spring 14, Fall 14, Spring 15). Full-time summer internship at the Toshiba Industrial Headquarters in Houston, TX. (Summer 2014) Collaborate remotely with other interns in Austin, TX and Application Engineers in Houston, TX. Software Developer (Undergraduate Research) Texas A&M University May 2013  –  October 2013  (6 months) College Station, TX Parasol Lab, Department of Computer Science and Engineering. 
 
For the Summer of 2013 I researched in the Parasol Lab under Dr. Nancy Amato as my Researcher Mentor. The summer project consisted of working with Microsoft's Kinect to sense objects for the iRobot Creates in order to successfully navigate a dynamic environment. This environment utilized an application named Caravanning with Multiple Robots, where multiple robots communicated with each other to find a path from the start to the goal position. 
 
● Developed C/C++ code utilizing and modifying the Libfreenect/OpenNI libraries for the Microsoft Kinect. 
 
Details: 
►Tools & Software 
● Microsoft Kinect 
● iRobot Create 
● Lubuntu 13.04 & Ubuntu 12.04 
● C and C++, VIM 
● Libraries: libfreenect; OpenKinect; OpenNI; OpenCV. 
► Summer 2013 REU (Research Experiences for Undergraduates). Retail Sales Representative Cricket Communications August 2011  –  February 2012  (7 months) Houston, TX ● Maintained the store and merchandise in proper condition. 
● Engaged and educated customers through product demonstration.  
● Participated in Marketing Events and activities to promote products inside/outside the store. 
● Obtained and received merchandise, totals bill, accepted payments, and made account changes for customers. 
● Provided assistance to customers in the selection and purchase of wireless telecommunications products and services. 
● Answered customer questions and resolved customer service issues relating to phone bills, equipment, products and services.
